greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Shifts 3 places left under binomial transform.
reference: N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..300
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210; arXiv:math/0205301 [math.CO], 2002.

M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210. [Link to Lin. Alg. Applic. version together with omitted figures]
S. Tauber, On generalizations of the exponential function, Amer. Math. Monthly, 67 (1960), 763-767.
formula: G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x) = 1 + x^3 * A(x/(1 - x)) / (1 - x). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 09 2020
maple: a:= proc(n) option remember; local k; if n<=2 then [1,0,0][n+1] else 1+ add(binomial(n-3,k) *a(k), k=3..n-3) fi end: seq(a(n), n=0..29); # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 05 2008
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = If[n <= 2 , {1, 0, 0}[[n+1]], 1+Sum [Binomial[n-3, k]*a[k], {k, 3, n-3}]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 30}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 24 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 05 2008
